For July and August, we offer a drop in on Wednesday afternoon where you can play for up to three hours, supervised by a bridge teacher. You will be able to ask questions of the teachers as you play the hands (£10 per drop in session). No need to have a partner. But if you don't have a partner, please let us know in advance if you are coming, so we can find you a partner.

We are also offering beginners’ and intermediate bridge classes every Wednesday afternoon for two hours. The next courses will start in September 2022 for ten weeks.

Come along and learn the world's most fascinating card game, taught by two enthusiastic teachers, both qualified bridge teachers with the English Bridge Union.

We aim to provide a fun and stress free environment where you can meet friends and share a wonderful hobby!

name: Go Social
description:
The opportunities to play Go on-line during Covid-19 restrictions are fantastic. There are many sites with thousands of players at any time day or night, but for me, playing on-line misses one of the key reasons I like to play - social interaction. This group sets out to make the on-line experience a bit more like a real-world Go club. We'll connect via Discord with audio and ideally video, and we'll play, discuss and teach on online-go.com (OGS). Whether you are new to the game or an experienced player, we hope to welcome you.
For a description of Go, see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Go_(game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Go_(game)). To learn the basics, try [https://online-go.com/learn-to-play-go/rules-intro](https://online-go.com/learn-to-play-go/rules-intro). To play on-line, register at [https://online-go.com/register](https://online-go.com/register). To enjoy playing, get help and encouragement, develop your skills, or just connect with enthusiastic, friendly people, join us!

name: Greenwich  Backgammon Club
description:
An informal monthly meet on the first Tuesday of each month to play backgammon.

We are affiliated to the UK Backgammon Federation (www.ukbgf.com). Suitable for anyone of any level of skill. At member's option, all scores can be added to the club's ladder and the national UKBGF ladder. 

Newcomers welcome with lessons given. A tournament for the more experienced.

Please note that numbers since our commencement have been from 12 to 20 and not the lower figures shown here as having booked purely on Meetup.

name: Ware Board Games Meetup
description:
Welcome to the Ware board game club. \

We meet regularly at each other houses to play board games, miniatures games, role playing games and party games of all types. The group includes all age ranges and abilities so do not be afraid to come along and give something a try. Once a month we hold a larger get together where we set up a few different tables and play a few games in the one night. This is a good starting place to get to know people. If you are new to gaming check out boardgamegeek.com for the difficulty level of games if you are worried. Anything below 2.5 in weight is pretty simple to pick up. Most of us aren't in it to win it so let's just have fun and hang out with good people :) \

Hope to see you soon \

Anna

name: Stevenage Boardgame Club
description:
Do you want to play Boardgames? Never played but sounds interesting?
If so join up and find others in the area to meet up with - simple!

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/StevenageBoardgame...
Discord server : https://discord.gg/wrTWzFQ
email : stevenageBGC@gmail.com

We play variety of games from Eurogames to "Ameritrash" to classics like Settlers of Catan / Dominions etc. People are always bringing new games as well so something new at every meeting.

We are a friendly fun social group and all are welcome regardless of experience.

name: East London Gaming at Rule Zero
description:
Do you love games? We do!

Sometimes (just sometimes) it's nice to have a night off computer screens to play games with old friends and new. If you are looking for new games, old games, new people to play with, then we can help!

Our bar, cafe, and gaming space is well set up for all manner of gaming, and with this Meetup, you'll be able to find new players of your favourite game, or indeed find a new favourite game to play with old friends. Join us!

name: London Women's Games, Snacks & Wine Group
description:
This is a meetup for women to get together to hang out, play some board or card games, drink some wine (bring your own to share!) and nibble on snacks together (please bring some to share!) and have an evening of fun and laughs!

**VERY LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE SO PLEASE RSVP EARLY! ONLY THOSE WHO RSVP WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND!**

**Location:** Bedford Avenue, London WC1B 3AD
*It's a 3-minute walk from Tottenham Court Road tube station.*

**Reminder:** RSVP is mandatory to attend.

**Please Note:** The address will be sent directly via private message on Meetup to those approved to join games night. Please have your notifications turned on for private messages.

\*\*\*Starting March 2022, I will be introducing a £3.50 per spot charge on each Meetup event. This will be used to cover the Meetup Organizer Membership fee and a monthly games subscription for game nights so we have fresh board and card games on each group event.

I also run a Games Group every 3rd Thursday of the month: [https://www.meetup.com/London-Bisexual-Women-Games-Wine-Group/](https://www.meetup.com/London-Bisexual-Women-Games-Wine-Group/)

name: Dicing With Life
description:
🎲Welcome to "Dicing With Life"
Join us every Tuesday ,Friday and Saturday for FREE community gaming sessions located at our shared Venue with Tea Tots soft play within Unit 11 on the ground floor of The Mercury Mall. From 7 pm we offer a wide variety of boardgames and card games for all abilities from our FREE to use community games libary.

🎲We have plenty of tables and chairs avalible with out the need to book in advance. Just turn up and play.

🎲There's no cost to play, our members are friendly and welcoming, and it's fun, so come along and join in!

(12.7.22)
Our current opening times are
🎲TUESDAY: 7pm till 10:00pm
🎲FRIDAY: 7pm till 10:30pm
🎲SATURDAY: 6pm till 10:30pm
We will increase our opening times in the near future.

🎲 We also have a friendly and welcoming WhatsApp group you can join if you'd like to 'meet' to some of the other players in advance, and chat about the games you'd like to play - just click here and say hello:
https://chat.whatsapp.com/FbqEruQoRxJJ9Nr2880CaZ 
you'll be greeted warmly :)
Also, check out our Instagram page to see the types of games we can offer, and give us a follow 😋
We hope to meet you for a game soon🎲

If you have any questions, send us a message and we'll get back to you with some answers.

🎲 One more thing, every Monday evening we hold a gaming session at The Golden Lion pub in Romford. Starting from 6pm till 11pm. The session takes place on the first floor where we offer a selection of games for you to enjoy with tables avalible all for FREE.
A great atmosphere to join a session of D&D, or come along and meet new Meeples and join in on some conversation and gaming. Why not grab a drink, order some pub grub and roll some dice with us!
Look forwould to seeing you there!🎲

🔞To comply with the venues health and safety laws, If you are under the age of 18, you must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Dorking: Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) 5e
description:
Who are we?

We’re a friendly bunch of D&D players with a range of experience; from a few weeks to a few decades! 

Based in and around the Dorking area (Surrey); we currently run over 30 campaigns of D&D (5th Edition), most of which are hosted on a fortnightly basis.

How does it work? 

Rather than hosting game days where players would show up on a first-come, first-serve basis, we focus on putting together groups of 6-7 people, who will run through either an official or homebrew campaign on a regular schedule. This way, you will really get to know your fellow adventurers, as well as your own character.

We do host one-off games every now and then which anybody can jump into - as well as large events where we all get together for drinks, food and games!

I've signed up, what next?

You should receive an email from Meetup (which may go to your junk folder) with instructions on which Session 0 to join next. As the dates for these are agreed once the group is full, you may need to scroll down our list of events to find it. That date will be a placeholder, so don't worry if it clashes with something else you have planned.

*You will need to RSVP to a Session 0 event in order to join a campaign.*

So what are you waiting for!? 

Join us now for what are bound to be epic times with great, like-minded people. There will be a few quick questions to answer when you join the group, and please be aware that it may take a little bit of time to get the next game filled (depending on how quickly we can find enough players and a DM).

You'll also find us on Facebook, where we share news, stories, and occasionally recruit new players for existing campaigns.

Thanks for reading!

N.B:

You must be 18+ to join the group.

name: Hertfordshire RPG Club
description: We are a fun group of people who meet every other Thursday evening to play table-top role-playing games in St Albans. Come and join us. No prior experience necessary.

name: Walthamstow Boardgame Group
description:
We're your friendly local London board game club meeting up on a weekly basis to play the very best of modern board games, card games and party games. We welcome everyone and anyone who wants to have fun playing games in a relaxed, enjoyable and safe environment, whether you are just starting to explore modern board games or are experienced with all this brilliant hobby has to offer, this group is for you.


We play a wide variety of games ranging from simple card games, social games to wonderfully challenging epic strategy board games. No experience needed, all games played will begin with a rules run down to get you up to speed. You can also bring and play your own games, choose from our games library or play games others have brought.


We meet every Tuesday at 6:30pm for our Digital Events. Hop online and get involved. Sign up to games or propose what you'd like to play! Sound good? Keep reading!


Join our wonderful community where most of our discussions and our virtual meetups take place, so drop in to chat games, ask questions and get involved with the community! https://discord.gg/mHZSKq2

name: Leighton Buzzard Board Games
description: A monthly all-day meetup for tabletop boardgames, card games, and similar.

name: Petersfield Cards And Dice
description:
What? <br>A friendly bi-monthly Meetup to play board, card and dice games. Join us to play a growing collection of Euro and US games that include Catan, Flashpoint, Village, Viva Java, Ticket To Ride, Coup, Perudo, Dominion, Hanabi, Compounded and more! We love learning and playing all kinds of games, so feel free to bring along your own too. <br> <br>Who? <br>Game players of all skill levels and interests are welcome. Whether you're a Board Game Geek or somebody new to the hobby who wants to explore the world of modern board games.
<br> <br>When/Where? <br>We meet on the second and fourth Thursday of every month at Winton House in Petersfield between 7pm - 10.30pm. <br> <br>Digital Games? <br> Find us at https://steamcommunity.com/groups/PCandD <br> <br>

name: Fleet Board Games Club
description:
Join us!
We are a group for anyone interested in board/card games in the Fleet area. We are enthusiasts for classics such as Settlers of Catan, Carcassonne, Ticket to Ride, 6 nimmt! and Love Letter (Monopoly, Risk, Scrabble don’t make it to our tables).
We now meet up every Wednesday at the Lismoyne hotel in Fleet. Our evenings do not have a set agenda - members bring a selection of their games and we play whatever people want to play.
Meet up with some friends, or make some new ones. Use the comments to ask any questions about the group and what games are being played.

name: Oxford On Board
description: Meet nearby Boardgame Players! Come to a Boardgames Meetup to play a wide variety of boardgames with a wide variety of people. All players aged 18 to 100 are invited!

name: London Terraforming Mars Gamers
description:
This is a group for people who would like to play the wonderful game that is Terraforming Mars.

This group exists to connect people for in real life games which can be held either at people’s own homes or at venues.

Some of our members are keen teachers of the game as they enjoy bringing the experience of Terraforming Mars to newcomers.

name: Southend Board Game Club
description:
Our home is The Iveagh Conservative Club in Leigh on Sea. The address is 69 Leigh Rd, Southend-on-Sea, Leigh-on-Sea SS9 1JW. The start and end times are 19:00-23:00.

If you walk uphill from Chalkwell train station, it is at the top of the road, about 15-20 minutes away (although the walk is quite steep). 

The Kings Road bus stop is right outside their front door. The number 3 and number 26 bus services stop there.

It supports our hosts (and therefore us) to buy drinks and food at the bar there.

name: Bucks Board Games Group
description:
If you enjoy playing board games and socialising then this group is for you!
We're a fun and friendly group where all ages and experience are welcome.
**We meet every Tuesday night from 7:00pm at the Wycombe Arts Centre, High Wycombe.** 
A few of the more well known games the group owns collectively:
Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Pandemic, Splendor, Codenames, Arkham Horror, Resistance, Terraforming Mars, 7 Wonders, Dead of Winter, Bang!!!, Dominion, Zombicide and many more!
Don't worry if you're new to board games, we are all new to one game or another. Come along and we'll happily teach you a game, or bring one of your own and show us how to play!

[https://www.facebook.com/groups/bucksboardgames](https://www.facebook.com/groups/bucksboardgames)

name: Puzzled Pint Oxford
description:
Puzzled Pint is a FREE event for puzzle-lovers occuring on the second Tuesday of every month. If you like logic puzzles, crosswords, escape rooms or drinking pints then Puzzled Pint is a perfect place for you to meet like-minded people and enjoy an evening of solving puzzles.

The weekend before each event, we post a location puzzle to our official web site (http://puzzledpint.com/). The solution will lead you to a local bar or pub.

On the night of the event, we'll be at the bar with more puzzles for you to solve while you enjoy drinks and food. If you don't have a team, we can introduce you to other puzzlers who want to join forces. And hints are always free!

name: Tabletop gamers of the London Docklands
description:
Hey there,

If you like to play board, card and dice games, to discover new games (there are so many!) or occasionally play old favourites, then this group is for you! If you think tabletop games are something just for kids, or something stuck in the past, let us show you some of the great modern physical games that exist and are enjoyed by millions of people of all ages. <br>

We meet (almost) every Wednesday evening at the Pepper Saint Ontiod pub, which is on the Isle Of Dogs, very close to South Quay and Crossharbour DLR stations, and about 10 minutes walk from the Canary Wharf Jubilee line station, and (almost) every Monday evenings at The George, which is right by Crossharbour station.

You can also join our Facebook group, for banter, gossip, games news and more.

name: Bedford Board Gaming
description:
We are a board gaming group in Bedford. We offer a chance to meet new people who share an enjoyment of board games. We're about having a bit of fun and spending an enjoyable and sociable time doing what we like best; which is ...obviously... gaming.

Come and enjoy your first meet-up with us for free. After that, we charge £2 on Wednesday nights and £1 on Friday night sessions. The money goes to covering our meetup fees, room hire and any spare goes towards games that can be won or used by members of the group. Tea and coffee is provided on Wednesdays and you can / should buy drinks at the bar on our Friday meets. <br>

If you're not a die-hard gamer, don't worry! We have plenty of games to start you off gently.... and are currently running some extra introductory sessions to lead you in gently. Our regular members tend to bring a good selection of games with them...but do try and sign up if you are coming so that we can cater for the right amount of people.

We never play Monopoly, Scrabble, Cluedo or Backgammon ;-) Chances are however that if you like those, you'll be blown away by the modern games that we adore. We don't have favourite games that get played every single week as we enjoy playing a wide variety of stuff...from quick 5 minute filler games to complex all-evening strategy games and everything in between. Worker placement, area control, deck building, hand management, take-that, tile placement, competitive or co-operative...we really do cater for most board game tastes. Don't worry if you don't know the rules. They will be run through at the start of the game. <br>

Any questions or worries? Just send us a message...we will happily answer any queries. We are a friendly bunch so don't be scared ... come and have some gaming fun!

name: Southend TTRPG Group
description:
Need some playtesters for a table-top RPG that I've written. 
I've written a number of game before, but have no friends round here to RPG with.
The game is DnD, WFRP inspired with mechanics similar to Dungeon World or Savage Worlds.
Expecting 4 hour-odd sessions on occasional weekends - hopefully turn a one-shot into a campaign!

name: Camberley Chess Club
description:
Welcome **chess** lovers! **We are Camberley Chess Club** with players of all ages, Juniors, Adults, Seniors, and of all skill levels.

We meet **Over The Board** on Sunday afternoons from 4pm to 6pm from 8th May to 25th September 2022 at Pine Ridge Golf Club, Main bar area outside or inside, Old Bisley Road, Camberley, GU16 9NX. Free parking.

**Simply come along** to see the club for yourself, play some good chess, and meet some members with no obligation to join.

https://camberleychess.co.uk/

name: Central London Board Games
description:
We are a group of passionate board/video gamers who play in Central London.

We play board games first Saturday and second Sunday afternoons of the month at The Queens Arms pub in Maida Vale/Kilburn and on the Fourth Tuesday evening at the pub in the Mad Hatter hotel in Southark/South Bank. Beginners welcome!

If you have an interesting game you would like us to play, feel free to bring it!

The meetup rules:

1. Be polite and courteous to each other, and everyone at the hosting location.
2. Please provide patronage to the hosting location if it's a pub/restaurant/cafe.
3. Events that have less than 3 attendees at the RSVP end time (an hour before the event) are likely to be cancelled.
4. 3 or more no-shows are cause for a permanent ban from the group. A No-show is someone who RSVPs yes and does not attend the meetup without informing the host either by message/comment/any other means. If you have a +1, that will count as 2 no-shows.
5. You may be removed from the meetup if you have joined but haven't attended RSVP or tried to attend the meetup for 4 months or more without informing the organizer either by message/comment/any other means. This won't result in a ban.

Meetup costs:
Owing to the bulging size of the meetup group itself as well as the number of no-shows, the meetups are no longer free. A Nominal charge will be applied to the meetup RSVP to help cover the cost of the meetup as well as for the board games.
Payment can be made either in cash at the event or to my Monzo bank account [https://monzo.me/muralikrishnakavassery/5.00?d=Board%20Games](https://monzo.me/muralikrishnakavassery/5.00?d=Board%20Games) (Sort code: 04-00-04, customer number: 95376376, Name: Muralikrishna Kavassery, Account type: Personal). Add the payment reference as "Board Game Meet".

name: Alder Valley GAmes Society(AVGaS)
description:
AVGaS is dedicated to facilitating collective games, Boardgames, Roleplaying Games and Collectable Card Games. Everything from DnD 5e to Star Trek, Arkhem Horror to Settlers of Catan, Card games like Star Realms and Magic: The Gathering, also Table Top wargames such as Flames of War or Warhammer.

If you have a game you'd like to play and you looking for somewhere to play it and someone to play it with then drop us a line.

name: East London D&D
description:
Provide an east london based meetup group for online and in person Dungeons & Dragons.

If you have played before or want to try it out we are happy to get you into a game! With Covid we have been usign a mix of Discord and Roll20 but once things clear up a bit more we will be running games in person. Each group will self organise once we have enough players and a DM. There is a mix of campaigns and one-shots generally run in d&d 5e but not limited to that.

-We have a active discord that can be found here: https://discord.gg/bgVJFtb
-We usually play in person at Rule Zero in Hackney Wick

name: New Addington Dominoes Club
description: Come & learn a great game, socialise & compete with other dominoes players in the community

name: London Indie RPG Meetup Group
description:
Try new games, meet new people, and find out what small-press role-playing games are all about!

We play tabletop role-playing games and story games like Monsterhearts, Love in the Time of Seið, and Fiasco that encourage everyone at the table to participate creatively.

We also organise Playstorms for budding designers interested in creating their own games from scratch.

New players are very welcome. Please check when our next meetup is.

SUPPORT THE GROUP - help out with Meetup subscription fees: http://ko-fi.com/indierpg


Indiemeet is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age or religion. As a group we all take a personal responsibility in greeting new members. Please come and chat to one of our volunteers, who will be happy to introduce you to the rest of the group, and are available throughout the meet, should you have any concerns. Indiemeet is a safe space where everyone is welcome.

Some of the venues we use may not be wheelchair accessible. Please check in advance, so we can make sure we can accommodate any individual needs.

We believe that gaming is for everyone. Regardless of who you are, or your level of experience.

name: Basingstoke Role Players Society
description:
We’re a collective of tabletop gamers who play RPGs around Basingstoke and a bit further out. We hold four public events a month on Mondays. Meet new people! Play games! Start an offshoot home game!

PUBLIC EVENTS!
• Game nights: One Shot Wonders (1st and 3rd Monday of the month)
• Social evening: Social & Shenanigans (2nd Monday)
• Discussion group: GM Workshop (4th Monday)

name: Potters Bar Games Club
description:
Hello! We're a friendly and free gaming group that meet in Potters Bar to play games of all types. 

We have about 30 members so far, and are looking for more! Usual attendance numbers are around 9-15 on any one night, so please 'ignore' the numbers on the meetup page :)

We play games ranging from Ticket to Ride, to Dead of Winter, Pandemic and Ghost Stories. All kinds of Euro games, designer games, card and board :)

This is our Facebook Page

And here is more info about the group on Board Game Geek


Our group is Sponsored by Gen42 Games (makers of Hive)

name: Dark Hammer (Letchworth) - Warhammer & Magic the Gathering
description:
Dark Hammer Games is a new game store in Letchworth Garden City.

Once the Covid restrictions are out of the way we will be running a number of weekly events, including (but not limited to) - Magic: The Gathering, Warhammer 40K / AoS games nights, Shadespire, Bloodbowl leagues etc.

Tables will also be available to hire during our weekend opening hours (08:00-19:00 Saturday, 10:00-16:00 Sunday)

With the Covid "Rule of 6" in force we will be limited to very small events initially. See individual meetups for more information.

name: Board Games & Social Games In n' Around E20
description:
In this Group We Play Game's, no experience necessary, many Member's have Game's and if you don't own any that's fine!!!

Some Meetup's may state a Type of Game in the Description and most are for any Game's!!!

We hold Meetup's in E20 & the surrounding Borough's (Hackney, Newham, Tower Hamlets and Waltham Forest)

name: Aylesbury Board Games Meetup Group
description:
This group is not just here for a particular meet or venue … the idea is a the various local meets and groups can post and chat here and hopefully create a community …


For info : there are groups representatives here for several established groups :

Weekly :


Hayden Hill Board Games (weds)

Milwrights Arms RPG (Monday’s)

monthly :


Hop Pole Beer and Board Games (semi regular - next one Sunday 19th Sept))

Millwrights Arms (monthly first Saturday)

There are other sessions. As normalcy returns they will be listed here.

These are all new comer friendly so just turn up someone will be there to involve you and teach if needed

name: SPOILS OF GREYHAWK - Tunbridge Wells D&D 5e Meetup Group
description:
Purpose: to assemble a group of regular players to enjoy D&D 5e scenarios and campaigns.

Members will be over 21 and can be experienced players or new to the RPG scene. We will run a meet-and-greet session ahead of starting any play sessions. All are welcome to come and observe before joining the group.

Meetings will be once a week on an evening that suits everyone, currently Thursdays 7:00 to 9:00 approx; there is a £5 per hour subs charge to cover the hire cost of the venue. [Sessions will need a minimum of three players plus the Dungeon Master to run successfully.]

name: Newbury And Reading Wargames
description:
Board games, tabletop RPG and miniatures games. Friendly group above a bar with food available.


Meetings are now open again after COVID-19 shutdown! However, bars are usually shut and food and drink will not be available. Please wear your mask and let us know that you are coming so we can manage numbers.

name: Brighton Indie Gamedev Events
description: A central hub for events in Brighton & Hove for Indie gamedevs of all shapes and sizes!  Video games, board games, card games, escape rooms etc.  All aspects of gamedev covered, from sound and art to design, coding, and everything inbetween!

name: Dicing With Life Havering -  Geeks & Board Games
description:
A club for board game lovers, tabletop gamers, RPG and D&D enthusiasts and geeks of all persuasions to converse under one roof - all ages and abilities welcome. 

Whatever you are into (Harry Potter, Zombies, Star Wars...), if you want to chat to like minded people or simply want to mingle with others (socially distanced right now, of course) while playing a board game or two (or three) all are welcome to join us at our weekly meetings. Currently, due to the move to Tier 4, all our games sessions are running online. 

We play anything from Monopoly to Munchkin, Scrabble to Settlers of Catan. Trivial Pursuit to Ticket to Ride and so on. It doesn't matter if you are a fan of tabletop board games and know what a meeple is, or have only ever played the golden oldies like Risk and UNO as everyone is free to participate in a very relaxed environment.

The venue we use when we are able to open is the Hope Board Games Cafe, in Romford Market Place. It has plenty of tables, and we have all required COVID measures in place to keep you safe. Members are encouraged to bring some of their own games along for others to play but each week various games will be on offer on a first come first serve basis for everyone to use if they wish. We also do playtesting for new games from time to time.

Our weekly meetings are held every Saturday from 12pm onwards at the Hope Cafe. 

82-84 Market Place,

Romford, Essex,

UK RM1 3ER

name: Epsom & Ewell Tabletop Gaming
description:
We are a gaming group based loosely around the Epsom & Ewell area with board gaming meetups at least once a week organised by the Epsom Games Club and looking to do more for Tabletop Roleplaying Games, Card Games, and Miniature/Non-Miniature Wargaming.

The Epsom Games Club Board Game Geek Guild Page can be found here.

name: Brighton Role-playing Games (RPG) Meetup
description:
Everyone welcome! Play Role-playing games (RPGs) of all flavours, from Dungeons & Dragons to indie storytelling RPGs. No experience necessary.

We've got an active Discord community for online play at: https://discord.gg/EAFPhgU

Current games and planned games include D&D, Monsterhearts, Pathfinder, Apocalypse World, Zeitgeist, Ten Candles and much more.

We play full campaigns, single adventures and one-off sessions of all sorts - players and GMs wanted!

You might want to join our boardgaming meetup too, over at: https://www.meetup.com/Brighton-Pub-Boardga...

And come to our summer Games Camp: https://www.meetup.com/games-festival/

And join our FB group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/brightonrol...

name: The Brotherhood Games TCG Tournaments
description:
Welcome to the home of The Brotherhood Games. We are one of London's largest Trading Card Clubs where we run weekly tournaments for Dragon Ball Super, Pokemon, Cardfight Vanguard, Final Fantasy and Yu-gi-oh!. 

 The Brotherhood run weekly meetups of 30+ players and additionally, we have run the largest regional qualifiers 3 years in a row as well as exclusive events. As we run our events with the official Konami tournament system, you can gain points to your world wide ranking where you will win prizes if you join the top 1,000 players. 



 Here you can find information about upcoming events, tournaments and regional qualifiers.



Please note:

We are a non profit club. Any money that is made on entry goes towards helping, provide a safe and great place to play card games.

Thank you

T.O Michael Loizou

name: Gaming Retro-bution
description:
Join us for regular weekly events across Brighton & Hove:


* Always free entry & free to play!


* A selection of our retro consoles set up around the bar.


* Select any game from a catalogue of 1500+ available from our menu.


* Change games as often as you like - just let us know what you fancy playing & we will change it over for you.


* Need some help navigating the menu screen or setting up a game? Just give us a shout, we are here to help you have the best time possible!


* 4 hours per event - plenty of time to explore the multitude of games available, play on several consoles & make some new friends along the way.


* Please buy a drink or some food & support the wonderful venues that make these nights possible.


Check out our website here! - www.gamingretrobution.com

or find us on social media - www.fb.com/gamingretrobution

                                              - ig : gaming_retrobution_uk

name: Marlow Board Games Meetup
description:
A group for anyone in the Marlow area interested in playing board and tabletop games. This might be Machi Koro, Puerto Rico, Scrimish, Go, Dominion, Agricola, Robo Rally, etc. Prior to covid-19 we had been meeting at the Marlow Donkey, near the railway station. For now, we're playing online, mostly at Board Games Arena.

We meet on the first and third Monday of every month.

name: Guildford Wargaming club Meetup Group
description:
Guildford Wargames Club meets every Monday night at St Johns community centre in Merrow, Guildford, from 6.30pm until 10.00pm.

Members of the club play historical wargames using figures in many scales including 6mm, 15mm, and 28mm. All periods are covered on air, sea and land from ancients through medieval and renaissance to modern. Members also play boardgames and occasionally run campaigns.

New members are always welcome and can normally find someone else who is interested in the same period they are.

name: South London Board Games
description:
WE ARE ON HIATUS UNTIL THE CORONA VIRUS OUTBREAK RESOLVES.

Update - November 2020

Dear South London Board Gamers,

We wanted to reach out to you and give you an update on South London Board Games.  

Given the current COVID restrictions, and the risks COVID poses, we are going to forgo Face-to-Face meetings for the foreseeable future.

The COVID crisis will end, and when it does, we will return, though potentially in a different way. In the meantime, the Discord and the Meetup will remain live. If anyone would like to arrange something using the platforms, please let us know, and if possible, and safe, we will help.

Additionally, there has been a boom in digital board games across all platforms. We are looking to create a Virtual Meetup to embrace these, but the high cost of many of these games makes that problematic. The Organizers will try and come up with something in the coming weeks/months.

Until we can meet again as usual, please keep safe, and remember you are not alone. SLBG will return.

The SLBG Organisers

---

Update - Spring 2020

In light of the outbreak of COVID-19/the Coronavirus, WE ARE GOING TO CANCEL ALL FORTHCOMING SESSIONS OF THE MEETUP. This was not an easy choice for us to make, but we believe it is the best way to keep everyone safe and healthy. We are not sure when we will restart, as this situation may rumble on for a long time. BUT WE WILL RETURN. We love gaming, and we are proud of the community that came together after Kyle founded the group all those years ago. 

In the interim, while we will not be running groups, there is the Discord Server, which, if you haven’t joined already, you can join via this link. This should allow us to keep in touch, arrange ‘virtual meetups,’ and maybe play some video games together. We will also keep the MeetUp running for the foreseeable future. 

Regarding the Coronavirus, please keep an eye on local guidance, but also the World Health Organization’s page on it. 

We aren’t going anywhere, and when we can, we will meet in person again. In the meantime, please keep an eye on the Discord Server, 


Stay safe, and if you can, keep gaming. 


Yours,


South London Board Games Organisers 

Kyle, Nick, Rich, Ed, Olley, Nick


---

In normal times, we are a regular volunteer-led board gaming night that meets in and around South London (specifically the Brixton, Clapham, Balham area). Most of the places we meet are typically pubs, which serve food.

We hope to offer a place where you can come learn, play and even teach games, some that you know, and some that are new to you. 

Our members supply the games, so please bring any along that you have and really want to play. But don't worry if you don't have any - there are always a few of us that get excited and bring along more than we need!

The games we bring change from week-to-week, covering a wide range of different games, from party games (Werewolf, Secret Hitler, Bang!...) to co-op games (Pandemic, Dead of Winter, Mysterium...) to competitive games where you are trying to beat out your opponents in an all-out quest to victory (Ticket to Ride, Concordia, Great Western Trail).

We're a really friendly group - everyone is welcome especially if you've never played these kinds of games before. There is always someone on hand to explain the rules to a new game.

name: Milton Keynes Role-Playing Games Club
description:
The Milton Keynes Role-Playing Games Club kind of does what it says on the tin. It's a club, in Milton Keynes, where we play tabletop, face-to-face role-playing games (like Dungeons & Dragons). 

We play mini-campaigns of around 8 weeks followed by about three weeks of one-off and short games. There's no agenda about what games get played: people propose games they want to run and the most popular ones get played. See the Current Games list for what we're currently playing.

We meet every Tuesday evening, 20:00 - 23:00, at York House in Stony Stratford, Milton Keynes. Just come along when you feel like it, no need to wait for the start of a block.

The cost of hiring the venue works out to about £14 (£7 concessions) per person per month, but your first two sessions are free, so you can see what's on offer. There's no profit involved, it's purely costs.

Note that this meetup group is purely for letting people know about the club; the club predates Meetup so we don't use this site for organising ourselves.

name: Poker Cash Games, London
description:
Poker Playhouse games (Bounds green only) and other non-affiliated London Cash games.

John [Admin]

name: DicingWithLife - Romford RPG and Dungeons and Dragons
description:
Calling all dwarves, elves, humans, orcs, aliens (or people who want to avoid aliens...), vaesen, ensigns, lieutenants and captains... and any other creatures of adventure looking for some people to share the journey with. If you want to play RPG's including Pathfinder, D&D, Alien, Star Trek Adventures and Vaesen with a friendly, supportive and fun group then come along and find us on Monday evenings at the Golden Lion in Romford Market Place.

Romford RPG and D&D runs as part of Dicing With Life, the overarching community games club, which also runs gaming sessions every Saturday at the Hope Cafe venue in Romford, and includes tabletop games, CCG's, RPG's, and video gaming. 

You do not have to bring or prepare anything (although you are welcome to if you want!). We have dice and dice trays available, and if you've never played before we will support you to develop a character and understand the rules of the game you are playing. If you do have dice, paper and pencils, please bring them with you.

Please RSVP to the event so we can get an idea of numbers. Spaces will be limited and will be on a first come first served basis.

Currently the group is quite busy and so it is recommended to message in advance and check that there is space available at a table before coming along for the first time. We have a friendly WhatsApp group you are welcome to join too if you'd like to meet other players and chat about the games we are running - click on the link https://chat.whatsapp.com/FbqEruQoRxJJ9Nr2880CaZ and don't forget to say hello - you'll be greeted warmly :)

name: Wallingford Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition
description:
We are group of people living around Wallingford that love playing Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

If you are wandering around Meetup in search of people to play D&D 5e, please stop, you have found the group your are looking for!

No matter if you just heard of D&D and intrigued by the idea of trying it, no matter if you are a veteran in search of new people in Wallingford, no matter how old you are, we accept everyone that comes to have fun and explore the fantasy multiverse of D&D 5e.

This group was created in June 2021 to gather everyone around Wallingford together and organize play events for all ages. You will find parents that want to introduce the game to their children, and you will find grown-ups that still wants to play and don't want to stop.


Please join the discord server https://discord.gg/dJb98z2KJE where we discuss and plan games and events.


Anyone under the age of 18 attending an event organized by this group must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Peckham/SE London Trivia Quiz Meetup Group
description:
How's your trivia?

Fancy yourself a music maestro - able to answer any musical question throughout the ages just by listening to sounds? Are you perhaps a wordsmith, with an uncanny ability to master the literary greats? Perhaps you're a visual artist, able to unjumble pictograms at a moment's glance and find the hidden meaning? Or perhaps you're a mastermind of general knowledge, adept at finding obscure answers to even more befuddling questions?

If so, then why not test your skills by joining us on Monday nights for a good ole fashioned pub quiz night?

The Quiz is held on Monday nights - so if you fancy joining as an individual or if you have an established quiz team already - why not pop down and take part. We'd love to have you join us for a night of fun, frivolity, facts, figures, and refreshments.

Entry is £2 per person (£1 for NHS workers and students) - and there's a £40 bar tap up for grabs to keep it sweet.

name: East-End Loose-Enders: Quizzes/Games/Movies for N1/N16/E8ers
description:
How long is a Blue Whale calf when it's born?
In which country is Bandaranaike International Airport?
What metal is the main constituent of Pewter?

If, like me, you have no idea about the answers to any of those questions, but are willing to throw caution to the wind and guess - then let's get quizzical.

This is a new 2018 Meetup group for fellow freaks and geeks around Islington, Stoke Newington & Dalston, who are interested in forming teams for things like pub quizzes, games nights and escape rooms, or catching a film / gig locally.

(Answers: 22ft, Sri Lanka, Tin)

name: Online Social chess
description:
Hi everyone, I am organizing this event to **meet interesting people** and **catch up with old ones** over a game of chess.

I am far from being a chess professional, i'm just a guy who enjoys the game. This place is **open for people of all levels**.

**Masterspace** allows people to **play, learn and talk** from the comfort of your own home. I am excited for you to try it out!

name: Catch or Catfish? - Dating Events (London)
description:
***At Buckbuck Games, we believe in bringing people together! Games with live human interaction stimulate collaborative and communicative instincts that quite simply - feel bloody brilliant! Let's uplift some spirits and make some connections...***

📣 Introducing our brand new event - Catch or Catfish? 📣

𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧 𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗟 𝗦𝗜𝗡𝗚𝗟𝗘 𝗣𝗘𝗢𝗣𝗟𝗘... 𝗔𝗡𝗗 𝗢𝗡𝗘 𝗡𝗢𝗧 𝗦𝗢 𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗟!
Bored of swiping and awkward first dates? Try a more exciting way to break the ice in this brand new dating event!

❇️ Meet new people in a speed dating-style format.

❇️ Get to know each date through fun mini-games, where outlandish ideas earn points. (The player with the most points wins a BOTTLE OF WINE!)

❇️ Find a match and we'll put you in touch.

❇️ One participant will be a secret Catfish - an actor with a false name, identity and backstory. They will attempt to complete secret objectives that aim to sabotage the romance!

❇️ Work together to figure out who's lying. Score BIG POINTS for being the super sleuth who correctly catches the Catfish!

Tickets and FAQs here:
https://www.designmynight.com/london/pubs/hackney/peoples-park-tavern/catch-or-catfish

𝘉𝘶𝘤𝘬𝘣𝘶𝘤𝘬 𝘎𝘢𝘮𝘦𝘴 𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘴𝘢𝘧𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘴𝘶𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘴𝘱𝘢𝘤𝘦𝘴 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘨𝘰𝘰𝘥 𝘰𝘭’ 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘧𝘧 𝘸𝘦 𝘶𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘤𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘺𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘦! 𝘊𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘴𝘰𝘮𝘦! 18+

name: Geek Hub AL10
description: Geek Hub AL10 welcomes you.  Join us for board, war and roleplay gaming.

name: Xscream Escapes
description:
"Meet new people, and make friends whilst trying to escape from a killer" sounds like your idea of fun? Then Join our social nights.

Half the battle with playing and escape room is organising your mates, get up to 8 people to agree the night, the time, the room, and then sort the money out, all this before you've solved your first puzzle!

Social Tuesday takes the stress out of all the fun!
Everybody pays the same price and arrives together to play an escape room and then afterward everybody goes to a local bar for food and drink! (not included (yet!)) and to continue the fun.

Any Questions give us a message
**https://wa.me/7898116380**

name: Pregnant & New Mums Group South London
description:
Are you pregnant or a new parent? If so please join our group where we will create a space for mums to connect and create meaningful friendships during this life changing time 💕 having a baby is beautiful but it comes with such hardships and challenges, having other mums around you that understand this is invaluable. 

We will have regular meetups and a whatsapp group to support & get to know each other 😊

name: Clapham Cycle
description:
Welcome to Clapham Cycle
**\*Please ensure you have registered and been approved at [Claphamcycleclub.com](https://claphamcycle.com) before applying to this group\***
At our core, we all love cycling, it has brought us together, it keeps us fit and healthy, and we love exploring the beautiful countryside. 
We are open to all abilities, ranging our rides from newbie rides all the way up to long distance sportives. Our calendar is jam packed with activities, with the intention of having “something for everyone” and nobody gets left behind.
You will notice on our rides that we use a colour code system to differentiate the difficulty. To understand this better and to work out which level you are at please read our ability guide here:
https://claphamcycleclub.com/[abilityguide/](https://claphamcycle.com/abilityguide/)
We now have over 190 registered members, with 3-4 rides every week, and with multiple trips abroad.
In 2019 we completed 256 events in total and for 2020 we aim to complete even more!
Join us, meet some new friends, and become a part of the fastest growing cycling community around.
*Please read out Do's & Donts before attending any of our rides (link below)*
*[http://www.meetup.com/Clapham-Cycle/pages/Clapham_Cycle_-_Do%27s_and_Don%27ts](http://www.meetup.com/Clapham-Cycle/pages/Clapham_Cycle_-_Do%27s_and_Don%27ts)*
**Pace Groups**
We will never allow more than 10 people in a group, so we if have more than one leader we will split into two or three groups. We will then split the pace the best we can, the faster riders in group 1 and so fourth. So 1 leader equals 10 cyclists, this is why you will see wait-list for a while until another leader confirms.
**RSVP Rules**
Our rides are getting very popular, please only RSVP if you are serious about coming. There is nothing worse than having no-shows and then people on the wait list missing out. If you no-show 3 times without 24 hours cancellation notice you will be removed from the group.
**Use Strava?**
We have our own club, please join! [https://www.strava.com/clubs/199520](https://www.strava.com/clubs/199520)
**Facebook**
Like us on Facebook! This builds awareness and helps u grown the community. [https://www.facebook.com/Clapham-Cycle-1021910764524300/](https://www.facebook.com/Clapham-Cycle-1021910764524300/)
**Whatsapp Group**
We have a Clapham Cycle SLACK group which is really useful if for some reason you do lose the group, as more than one person on the ride can see your messages. Join here: [https://claphamcycle.com/chat](https://claphamcycle.com/chat)
**Feedback**
We value all feedback from our members, and in particular in relation to your experience on the ride. Please email ridefeedback@claphamcycle.com – We promise to review and ensure your identity remains anonymous if you so wish.

Happy Cycling :-) 
Thomas
thomas@claphamcycle.com

name: Richmond Park Rouleurs
description:
Richmond Park Rouleurs is a road cycling club catering for (nearly) all levels of ability. Whether you are looking to improve your group riding skills, get fit, train for a big event, or just looking to meet fellow minded people, then the Rouleurs could be the club for you! 
We are a non-profit organisation run entirely by volunteers. The club is affiliated with British Cycling and for as little as £35 per year our members get to take part in weekly rides, socials, holidays, training events, etc. If wanting to join as a full member then please go to [http://rprouleurs.co.uk/membership](http://rprouleurs.co.uk/membership). 
Our main ethos is to ride as a group, we stop for punctures, and leave nobody behind. We have many groups out of varying levels with the main purpose of getting back to the pub safely for a few beers with the rest of the team, though most club rides will require you to be able to ride 40-50 miles. If you are concerned about keeping up, then talk to one of our more experienced members.
We schedule laps around Richmond Park most Saturdays to encourage new members along. Whether a beginner or an experienced rider, we can find you the right paced group to ride with and meet some of the regulars on a nice leisurely ride.
Don't forget to check out our [website](http://rprouleurs.co.uk) and social networks on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/richmondparkrouleurs/), [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/RPRouleurs)and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rprouleurs/)!
Why not purchase some of our club kit and feel really part of the club! [https://www.saddledrunk.com/richmond-park-rouleurs](https://rprouleurs.co.uk/shop).
We have many exciting events coming up, including cycling holidays, monthly club socials as well as some epic rides.
Why not join in the fun?

[https://youtu.be/V9W0hmgvsXE](https://youtu.be/V9W0hmgvsXE)

name: Bromley and Beyond Entertainment Society
description:
All are welcome but we are a primarily a group of fun- loving over 40s who enjoy a wide range of events in Bromley, the surrounding areas and London.

So if you are finding it difficult to expand your social group or feel stuck in a rut, join us for theatre, quizzes, cinema and many more fun events.

You will need to become a full member with an annual fee.

The membership fees are charged primarily to cover charges by MeetUp to host the site and any profits will be invested back into the group with both a summer picnic and Xmas Party.

**THE BORING BIT BUT PLEASE READ.**
**Please ensure your profile includes a picture of yourself. This is so we can identify you at your first event.**
Please only join if you can attend an event within 3 months as we like to get to know all our members. 
This is primarily a group for people who want to socialise and make new friends. Please do not send unsolicited messages to other members. This will result in removal from the group.
There is often a waiting list for events so if you can not make an event, please change your RSVP to no as soon as possible. 
If you need to cancel on the day, please contact your organiser directly and not by leaving a comment on the site.
Three no shows will result in removal from the group.

name: Free Health & Wellbeing Events: Living in a Post-COVID World
description:
**Become healthier, calmer, and happier for you and your family in a post-COVID world**
A programme of free activities promoting health and psychological wellbeing over the Summer of 2022.

Welcome!

Here you will find a series of events in London's Westminster area over the summer, offering residents the chance to learn skills to improve their quality of life after the pandemic; and facilitating conversations between attendees so everyone can share their experiences, ask questions, and discover how everyone is coping.
You will learn skills on psychological wellbeing, healthy eating, physical movement, and mindfulness.
-> We will be offering a weekly outdoor gentle yoga class for parents & children to improve health and wellbeing, followed by coffee/tea and a group conversation;
-> Classes to reduce anxiety and stress for parents and children in a post-covid world;
-> Group discussions for exchanging experiences and coping strategies related to health, lockdown, vaccination, anxiety, conditions developed post-covid, and related topics.
Classes will be free to attend, but we request that you RSVP here as spaces are limited.

The events are part of the **Health Equalities Programme,** which is an initiative by Portobello Business Centre (PBC) in conjunction with the Royal Borough of Kensington & Chelsea Borough Council.

name: Active Muslims 🔴🟡🟢
description:
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

السلام عليكم / Greetings!
 
This group is for people who want to get active, love to be active, love the outdoors & love nature. Whether through hiking, biking, walking, kayaking, or simply volunteering, sharing and caring. A group to resonate with like-minded people, to enjoy activities together, share positive and enlightening experiences, make meaningful connections and create good memories. Making such activities consistent and a habit to foster your sense of overall well-being and enable you to feel resilient and powerful.

This group is open to all, including non-Muslims, we simply ask that you are considerate and respect the traditions, values and culture of the group and each other.
 
*“Your body has a right over you” - regular activities are an investment in your mind, body, and soul.*

name: Wild Women Book Club
description:
Women today are immersed in a culture that demands that they remain focused on a youthful appearance and outward beauty. We are missing the community, rituals, practices, and stories that support us as we deepen into the rich experience of womanhood.

We start with the group by reading the book "Women who Run with the Wolves". It has some profound things to say about the primordial feminine instinct that many have forgotten.

Women who Run with the Wolves is for people who want to understand each other, work on their identity and self-worth, and heal emotional wounds.

name: Ealing Ladies Social Group (for ladies over 45)
description:
What we're about

Dear Members to be


Welcome to Ealing Ladies Social Group!  This information is to let you know who we are and to inform you of the group ethics and values which are set to maximise the enjoyment of the group.


Ealing Ladies Social Group (ELSG) was set up seven years ago. The aim of the group is to have meetups on a regular basis aiming for members to meet-up at least a couple of times a month. All events endeavour to allow members to get to know each other in an intimate sociable setting to enjoy a feeling of 'friends getting together'. To encourage this, we may limit numbers of attendees for certain events and the group has a cap on the number of members at 40.


The membership fee is £10 on joining and then £10 every year paid by standing order to be paid on July 2nd each year – to coincide with Meet Up’s annual fee payment. It is important that you meet up with the group before your membership is approved.


All paid-up members automatically become ‘event-organisers’ allowing them to put up events.


Events - All members are expected to put up an event at some stage so that everyone appreciates the efforts that go into running the group. However, this is by rotation of members and only one member has to do this each month, so if we have 40 members your turn will only come around every 40 months! Outside of "your month", you can put up any number of events you wish, but please consider the day you put up events to avoid clashes.


Age range - Membership is limited to the over 45s to encourage common ground amongst the ladies.


Photos - When you join ELSG you are asked to include a photo that identifies you. This helps us spot newcomers at events. Some people choose to put up a photo of an inanimate object, which is unhelpful thus we are unable to accept members without a full-face picture.


RSVP - Once you decide to attend an event you must RSVP it. This lets the organiser and members know who they should look out for at the event. If no one RSVPs an event, it may be cancelled or rescheduled – so it is not advisable to just turn up without RSVPing! Moreover, if you RSVP an event and fail to turn-up you could leave the host hanging around by themselves – PLEASE BE CONSIDERATE!


First-timers - The first time you RSVP an event it is advisable to let the event organiser know this is your first time so they can make sure they look out for you or perhaps exchange numbers with you in case of any last minutes changes. There is a comment box beneath each event where you can enter text which is the best way to liaise with the event organiser.


Termination of membership – this is very rare! If you are considerate, friendly (especially to new-comers), non-cliquing, capable, reliable and engage with the ELSG site to keep up with events and notifications then I do not imagine you’ll have any issues :o)


ELSG has been running for seven years now and experience has shown us that members who run into difficulties are those who imagine that ELSG is an automated system – it is not, humans run it. It is important that members refer to the site to keep updated on events and news - no one has the time to hold your hand :o(


Last and most importantly - overall, we're a friendly group who enjoy a glass or two. If you fancy joining, have no major hang-ups and you’re friendly and enjoy a natter in addition to being a lady of a certain age, then ELSG is possibly the meet-up group for you.


Hope to meet you at an event soon!


Maria

description:

The Tue session is mostly full - No space for new members
The Sat session has space for new members
\-\-\-
(Before adding you to the group, play badminton with us first)

Kingston Badminton Meetup (KBM)

This is a group for anyone who wants to or already plays badminton.

It's about having fun and meeting other people to play badminton with, at all levels of fitness and skill in a fun, friendly, and relaxed environment (safety to reduce injuries being very important).

We are a relatively small but very busy and established badminton group, having grown over nearly 5 years now.

We currently play on Saturdays, Tuesdays and Fridays, playing only with feather shuttles.

The sessions are roughly matched in skill level (generally):
Every Saturday - Beginners Level - Beginners (less than 1 year)
Every Saturday - Mixed Level - Lower Mid plus (1 year plus)
Every Tuesday - Mixed Level - Lower Mid to Int (2 years plus)
Every Friday - Mixed Level - Lower Mid to Int (2 years plus)

Hope to see you soon at a session

Regards
Mo Malik (KBM)(KBBM)

name: GIN (Gay Indian Network) The LGBTQIA Indian Network in UK
description:
Connecting (and supporting) the LGBTQIA community of Indian Heritage and the wider Diaspora with each other and their friends and allies in London and the United Kingdom.

GIN is a fun and sociable networking group for LGBTQIA community of Indian origin and their friends and allies that would like to get to know each other in a friendly group.

We have around 5 meetups per month (both physical and online). We also have a monthly “deeper connection” Saathi conversation group.
We organise trips to museums, places of interest, Indian restaurants, LGBTQIA social support events, Bollywood and Bhangra playing LGBTQIA clubs, And we also have the occasional fun party or two 😃

This group is open to all LGBTQIA people of any nationality or race that are interested in getting to know more about India and people of Indian origin.

To help our members stay connected, we also have:

1\. GIN & Lime Womens' group\.

2\. GIN Book Club & GIN Film & Arts Club\.

3\. GIN 1 to 1 Buddy Telefriending Service\.

4\. GIN Midlands for members in Birmingham\, Coventry\, Leicester\, Nottingham\.

5\. GIN & Bombay Tonic Whatsapp Group with over 140 members\.

Website:

https://www.gayindiannetworklondon.com

Twitter: @GINindianUK

Instagram: @ginindian

name: The Optimistic Entrepreneur - London, UK
description:
The Optimistic Entrepreneur is here to keep you motivated, positive and help you take action to achieve your goals.

**Is the glass half full or half empty?**  
Half empty? We will give you the right people to get you to fill it up.
Half full? We will give you the right people to get your glass overflowing.
**Win. Win.**

We connect you with the right people to **develop the mindset and strategies required to hit your goals.**

Are you taking steps to financial freedom? Do you feel stuck in the procrastination trap? Join us on the journey to discover:

* Strategies to earn a passive income
* Find out how successful entrepreneurs think
* The mindset required to become financially free

Nelson Mandela: 'I never lose.  I either win or learn'. Let's keep winning and learning together. 😊

We would love to have you join our Facebook Group - https://www.facebook.com/groups/329674949381363/

The Optimistic Entrepreneur Meetup Group supports the policies and principles of Meetup. We make no guarantees and we do not offer financial services or assurances. All our workshops are FREE To attend.

name: South London Smashers LGBTQ Tennis Group
description: We are an LGBTQ tennis group based in South London. Come along and play some tennis, our current locations are Tanner Street Park and King George's Park. All tennis levels welcome, we run friendly, social tennis sessions where we play timed sets of doubles, changing partners every 25 minutes so you can meet and play with multiple players. Any questions, drop Ryan a message.

name: F.R.I.E.N.D.S
description:
Debate👩🏻‍🎓, Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️. All are welcome 🌍

Meet like-minded people for new friendships.

Then come on out and join us for our Free Speed Friending social!

We arrange for you to meet and chat with each other. This gives you an easy and convenient way to meet new people in a way that completely dissolves barriers. This is NOT speed dating and so you will be meeting both ladies and gentlemen in mixed groups. The intent is to create friendships.

One of the greatest benefits is that this tears down the walls of shyness. Many people have deep-seated anxiety when it comes to talking to people they don’t know. But when you push outside your comfort zones, this speedy connection opens up the door to allow you to easily communicate and work together with other members of the group.

Speed friending allows you to identify other people with common interests. The conversations that take place don’t have to be deep, profound or even scripted; simply discussing likes and dislikes may lead to future friendships. Often, people want to make new friends, but they aren’t quite sure how to go about it. With speed friending, you can start pursuing that goal.

How to participate: Free Events
Download the Zoom app for free on a desktop or mobile device.
After you click attend, you'll see the Zoom link to join the event.

What happens in the event:

1️⃣ Upon entering the event you will be in our virtual lobby where our event hosts will welcome you. We will explain how the event works.

2️⃣Group Activity - Breakout rooms with different topics. You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room with a topic. Participants can self-select and join different breakout rooms that have topics the host has created.

3️⃣ You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout rooms.

4️⃣ Once the event ends you can go to the attendance list and message your mutual matches.

🤔 Help during the event.

You can reach your event hosts at any time during the event.
If you click Ask for Help in Zoom, it will notify the meeting host that you need assistance.

Is it safe?
Absolutely - All our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session. if you have any issues, report them to the hosts.

❤️ Feel free to support the group ❤️

https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=2VALHT5MVY7C4
or
https://www.buymeacoffee.com/MeetUp

Important Rules
Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behavior will lead to immediate removal from the event.

⚠️Important Reminder ⚠️
Please ensure that when you register your attendance you actually attend the event. If you do decide not to attend please click not going.

name: Practice Jazz Jams | London
description:
*If you're getting started with jazz, looking to build up a repertoire of standards and learning to improvise with other musicians in a relaxed environment - try out the 'novice setlist' sessions*

*If you're already comfortable with the above, but are looking to improve the more nuanced aspects of your playing and over more challenging standards - then check out the 'intermediate' sessions*

This group is open to all levels of musicians who would like to learn and explore jazz standards & improvisation with others in a friendly & supportive environment

If you're new to the group and had some questions on how it all works just drop me (Xie) a message!

A contribution is charged to cover payment of the room hire, meetup's monthly organiser fee, and my time in organising the sessions.

name: Bexley and Bromley Belles
description:
We are a group of ladies 45+ looking to meet new friends in Bexley Bromey and surrounding areas. We enjoy eating out, fine dining, theatre, cinema, visiting London, walks, afternoon teas and breaks away.
To join there is a membership fee of £5 From then on fees are £10 every 6 months due in January and July.
Members are encouraged to organise their own events if they wish to.
Anyone not attending an event in 6 months or cancelling 4 times in a row will be advised and taken off the group. This will keep the group active and not just ‘full of numbers‘.
If for any reason you can't make an event please change your RSVP. This enables others to take your place and also means a likely refund of any monies already paid. Please note refunds can only be given if replacements are found. Anyone with 3 no-shows without changing their Rsvps will be taken off the group . Where deposits are asked for they are non-refundable. If an event is prepaid please pay by the stated date or no later than 2 weeks after event goes on the site. Only people with photos on their profile with be accepted into the group - no animals flowers or cartoons please.
The aim of this group is to be fun, friendly and to try new places and things to do. We look forward to welcoming you.
Disclaimer: this group does not take any responsibility for injury or loss during events or changes of times dates and venues that are unavoidable.
