description:
We are a friendly group of ladies from Bexley, Crayford, Dartford, Sidcup and surrounding areas. This group is aimed at ladies in the 50 plus age group who feel they would like to make new friends. Do you want to chat over a coffee, go for a walk, see a film, dine out, or a number of other activities? Come on then ladies lets build a Circle of Friends!
Occasionally some venues are small so numbers will be restricted, we normally have a waiting list for these events in case someone can't make it, so click on the rsvp anyway and that will add you to the wait list, and check back near the time to see if you have been added to the event.
So you can't find something to fit in with your commitments, why not host an event? Please speak to one of the organisers.

**Membership fees are used to pay the costs that Meetup charge for us to use this site.**
Membership fee is £5.00 per year due by 1st December each year. Any members who haven't renewed by 1st December risk being removed.
New members have **two months** to join in as many events as they would like before membership will be due if you decide to stay with us.
**New members fee is £5.00 due two months after joining**, renewal due 1st December every year thereafter.
Members may bring a friend (+1) along to 3 meetups as a guest. After this they would need to join and pay their membership fee before attending more events. **Please note that popular events will be available to members first, therefore I would urge you to encourage your +1 to join otherwise they could miss out!**
We look forward to meeting you all.

**The rules**
If you RSVP yes to an event and then for some reason you can't make it please change your RSVP to not going at least **24hrs** prior to the event starting **preferably 48hrs**, **this includes the waiting list**, as it's unfair when people don't show up or cancel at the last minute, it holds up the group waiting for someone who's not coming, plus may prevent others from attending an event that's full.

Also anyone who repeatedly RSVP's to events and then cancels will risk being removed from the group, as this prevents others from joining in.

DO CHECK YOUR DIARIES BEFORE SAYING YES TO AN EVENT!!!!

**To remain a member you will need to have attended an event in the last 6 months, this is to enable new members a chance to join.**

Sorry but if you RSVP yes 3 times and then don't show up without changing your RSVP to not going you will be removed from the group.

All members are required to have a **profile picture of their face not views, pets or other family members!**

That's it for the rules, so we look forward to seeing you all and building our circle of friends. x

name: Cyber Security Skills Meetup
description:
**Join Cyber Skills Meetup!** [Promoted by QA](https://www.qa.com/training/courses/cyber-security/), hear from industry experts focused on cyber skills and development. Our community speakers will share their knowledge on cyber skills innovations, [resources](https://info.qa.com/thecyberpulse), emerging technology, and key challenges in the Cyber skills space.

Whether you’re embarking on a career in Cyber security or already have experience, the free Cyber Security Skills Meetup aims to empower you with the knowledge and insight you need to advance your career. By attending the QA Cyber Skills Meetup you will be eligible for ISC2 CPE's.

Check out our free cyber resources at the QA [CyberPulse hub](https://info.qa.com/thecyberpulse).

name: Ealing Art and History Social - 20's and 30's
description:
Hello and welcome to the newly created Ealing Art and History Social!

Around once a fortnight there will be either an activity centred around art or history or it will be a social activity in the Ealing area. Art/history activities can include a trip to an art gallery, a history museum, a life drawing class or anything else art/history related in London/UK. For any events not in Ealing, the plan will be to meet either at Ealing Broadway or Ealing Common station but you can always meet at the activity location.

Some events might require a purchased ticket in which case it'll be outlined in the event itself, otherwise lots of art galleries and museums are free so should be a cheap social group!

Just a disclaimer: I'm not affiliated with, paid by, or endorsed by any of the places I set up trips to visit. I'm just setting this up to link up with people with similar interests in art and history

name: Encore: Theatre and Events for Friends to Enjoy
description:
Encore: Theatre and Events for Friends to Enjoy is a friendly and sociable not for profit group, primarily based around South Bucks, Gerrards Cross, Chalfonts, Amersham, Chesham and surrounding area. However, if you don’t live in that area you can still request to join if able to travel to and from events.

If you are 40+ and looking for new friends and things to do why not give us a try?

Theatre has always been a key aspect of our group and we have been to numerous performances over the years since the group started in June 2016. We have had some challenging times during the Covid Pandemic but we are now beginning to look at putting on more events as people begin to venture back out on the social scene.

Apart from Theatre our events can be anything from comedy nights, party breaks, quiz nights, outings, music nights, cinema, meals out, walks, guided tours, picnics, informal parties etc.

The extent and number of events will depend on what people are prepared to offer to the group. The organisers are not able to do everything so we are particularly interested in new members who are willing/able to host/organise events.

We appreciate not everyone is comfortable with uploading a face photo but this is preferred if possible as it does help with identification when meeting up for events (especially new people). However, if you prefer just add a photo of anything to get through the photo required section.

Also with new members there is an admin/joining fee required (currently £5 for individual membership or £10 for plus one membership) to go towards MeetUp fees.

Encore: Theatre and Events for Friends to Enjoy is a Closed Group (acceptance for membership is at the discretion of organisers subject to availability). Please do not be offended should it not be possible to accept a request to join. This is more likely if you already belong to 10 or more other MeetUps as we are looking for active members and if you already belong to loads of other groups that's unlikely. If accepted you will need to attend at least one event every year (but hopefully you will want to join us at many more that). Current members can also recommend people to join the group.
 
We hope you will enjoy being a part of Encore and if you have an idea for a show or event please let me know and we will investigate, or better still have a go and organise it yourself as it will be possible to add extra organisers to Meetup.

name: KENRIC Lesbian Social Group
description:
We’re a vibrant, inclusive and supportive social group, run entirely by volunteers. Founded in 1965, KENRIC has been organising a wide variety of enriching events ever since, making us the UK’s longest-running social group for lesbians. We arrange all sorts of online and face-to-face gatherings, ranging from walks, picnics, parties and gallery trips to crossword-solving, poetry and book readings.
The KENRIC Meetup Group is free to join and membership is open to all lesbians, including trans women who identify as lesbian.
KENRIC embraces and promotes equality, diversity and inclusion for all its members. Our organisation’s commitment to providing a safe environment within which its members may meet and feel comfortable together is central to our **Mission**: “KENRIC creates a vibrant, inclusive and supportive community for all lesbians by providing a mix of enriching and enjoyable social events.”
KENRIC aims to ensure that these commitments are embedded in its day-to-day practices with all full members and associate members so that they are treated fairly, openly, honestly, with dignity and respect. Full details of our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion (EDI) Policy can be found here: [https://kenriclesbians.org.uk/edi/](https://kenriclesbians.org.uk/edi/)

Please note that we require all members of our Meetup group to either include a genuine photo of their face in their Meetup profile or to email a photo of their face to the KENRIC administrators at [verifyid@kenriclesbians.org.uk](mailto:verifyid@kenriclesbians.org.uk) 
All photos will be deleted after verification, in accordance with KENRIC’s Privacy Policy.

**Membership**
**Associate members:** Meetup-only members, guests and event attendees who do not hold membership cards. 
**Full members:** Women who have subscribed to KENRIC and who are in possession of a current membership card. Benefits of full membership include priority booking and discounted entry to events, our monthly newsletter and access to our private members’ Facebook group.
Full membership costs from £15.00 per year and more information can be found here: www.kenriclesbians.org.uk

name: Deep Connections London
description:
Welcome to a space where we connect deeply with ourselves and others. Each event is designed to support you in **being more raw and honest, to hold back less and come *ALIVE***!

You'll get to know yourself better while letting others see the **real**, unfiltered you. You'll get to the heart of who you are much faster, in the company of other great people. This creates an opportunity for better, deeper connections.

**Judgements are *not* welcome here**. We leave them outside of this space. We are all messy humans. We make mistakes, react out of pain, say stupid things. We have all been laughed at, ridiculed, attacked in some way for the way we talk, look or because we expressed something honest. **We have all held back because of fear.**

We are here to better ourselves while connecting with people we spark with. Friends, collaborators, romantic partners....There is potential for all types of healthy connection, because...

***Through Deep Connection, Anything Is Possible!***

When we interact without bias or neediness, we open the door to all possibilities. You'll have the opportunity to do that while learning how to connect far deeper than you may realise you are capable of.

Here, we won't just talk, we get to the depths of our souls quickly. We connect while removing the crap that often gets in the way.

Join in with the interactive talks and workshops. You will learn, grow and connect. As the community grows there will be more immersive events and activities. The more you show up and interact, the more we will get happening.

You may recognise the name of this group. Deep Connections London is a group I originally created 6 years ago. I co-facilitated it with a friend for 2 years. We had over 3000 members and hosted around 400 events - Talks, workshops, all day challenges and retreats. It was THE place to connect deeply in the heart of London.
I am proud of what we did, and of our members who kept showing up to further their journey into deeper connection.

We closed the group because our lives needed to go in different directions, but I never stopped missing our members or my events. I know that many will benefit from living a more deeply connected life..myself included... So, I'm bringing it back and expanding it throughout the UK and beyond.

I can't wait to meet you and embark on this beautiful adventure!

*With Passion, Purpose and Love*

*David Saville*

name: FRENCH LONDON EXPERIENCE - FLE
description:
"You will love French, the French and France". 

French London Experience is an intiative that I've launched to promote connections between French and British cultures. 

It offers various ways to practise your French and to learn about French culture. We have a lot of events and services to improve your knowledge about France, its people, culture, history, political organisation, culinary traditions, way of life and way of working, and much more... 

The activities take place in different forms - meetings, one-to-one, small groups, sessions, lectures, guided tours - in a variety of venues such as cafes, parks, companies, theatres, cinemas, gardens, exhibitions, museums, meeting rooms, and online.

Attendees will be encouraged to engage in different ways along events.

Last, a native French professional, I offer private tuitions and can reply to a various range of specific requests from lessons to works or any support in French (training, welcoming, writing, speaking, voice-recording,...)

Keywords are ENTHUSIASM, ADAPTABILITY and PASSION

Any question or request?
Drop me a line frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com

Website
[https://www.frenchlondonexperience.com/](https://www.frenchlondonexperience.com/?fbclid=IwAR3AqarNR1W5yav_DL1dCNuQddEOSgDju762CbuIV2HbknnrL4z8rB2Iqas)

List of public events:
[https://www.meetup.com/French-London-Experience-Meetup/](https://www.meetup.com/French-London-Experience-Meetup/?fbclid=IwAR3AqarNR1W5yav_DL1dCNuQddEOSgDju762CbuIV2HbknnrL4z8rB2Iqas)

name: Nubian Spa Travel & Social
description:
(This Group is for Black Sisters Who enjoy having a fun time & living life 2 the max!)

Hi, I'm here to bring a little bit of joy to your very busy lives. My name is Karen. I've been organising Spa Days and weekend Breaks for my friends and family for some time now. I thought it would be a good idea to extend that to like minded Black Londoners who have a need for a little bit of Me Time and Pampering and social events Like nights out,Plays, day trips, Dinner nights out, Afternoon Teas, Comedy shows and concerts.

The aim of this Group is too cater for those of us who would sometimes like to go away on a weekend or over night Spa Break. also holidays however everyone you ask is either busy or broke.....lol. this group caters for all couples singles who want to make friends have ,a travel buddies, room mates and so on. Its a fantastic opportunity just to have some good "Ole Chill Out Time" and make friends.

The Meetups for this group are straight forward and uncomplicated. This means all the events will show the cost of each event that will be booked by myself in order to get the best priced group deal, travel will be the responsibility of each individual all information will be posted. As most of the events will be in Hotels not too far from London and surrounding areas. Checking will be up to yourselves so no pressure to rush around if you cannot make a certain time. Most of the Events will include an evening meal, and breakfast and use of all Spa facilities we can use these times to meetup and talk and have a bit of fun , however it is solely up to the individual like I said no pressure. Treatments may be induced on some events.if not they can be booked at an extra cost. There will be a£3.00 - £8.00 admin charge for all events.

This group is only for people that are very serious about going on Spa Breaks and holidays refunds can not be offered once you have paid a deposit! ..... as details and bookings need to be made way before hand, so no time wasters please.

I look forward to your opinions and feedback. And of course meeting you!

K.

name: London Black Chicks Network
description:
**CLEAR PICTURE OF YOURSELF NEEDED TO JOIN. Please also respect that this is a space for black and mixed race women.**

**To encourage only serious RSVPs there will now be a £2 non-refundable fee per event.** 

**NO-SHOW POLICY**
You will be removed from the group if you are a no show. This is defined as not attending an event you RSVPd to or cancelling a few hours before the event, because lets be honest if you haven't bought a ticket, you already know you're not going. Be respectful of the hosts and update your RSVP in good time.

🌸LBCN is here to create a safe space for black and mixed-race women to come together and mingle through social events, travel and more!

🌸All we ask is that everyone treats each other with respect and brings good vibes. Anything other than that and you will be removed.

Any events you’d personally like to host or suggestions are always welcome because you’re bound to find someone else who will be interested x

name: Moon Circles, Ceremonies, Meditations & More
description:
You are invited to join this group and attend one of the many circles, ceremonies and free live morning meditations I will be offering.

* **OFFERINGS:**

**Free Morning Meditations**

Weekly 30min morning meditations where we'll explore and I'll guide different types of meditation, depending on the energies of that morning (e.g. breath-work, movement, visualisation, guided meditation etc.)

**Moon Circles & Cacao Ceremonies**

There will also be beautiful sacred monthly moon circles & cacao ceremonies that you are welcome to join. These will be held at an intimate space in Tooting, SW London. Some of these will be for women only and others will be mixed where all is welcome.

**Yoga Therapy for the Mind: 8 Week course**

In-person Yoga Therapy for the Mind, to relieve stress, anxiety and depression.

**About me**

My life's work is to help people feel safe, loved and to integrate their past so they can enjoy more peace and freedom in their lives.

I am an experienced Counsellor, Holistic Therapist & Priestess. I combine traditional talk therapy with hypnotherapy, EFT, Theta Healing, Reiki, Yoga & meditation, with deep intuition and wisdom, to offer an integrative healing experience. And I love creating deep and beautiful spaces for people.

The spaces I offer are always lovingly created for you to feel so safe in, and to feel so held, that your heart feels it instantly and is able to drop more deeply into yourSelf. And in that love you receive, so much healing can happen

I hope to welcome you soon!

Love, Mariam x

name: Women 30s-40s Club
description:
This is a group for women who want to take advantage of all the city has to offer - and most importantly, meet others who do too!

All women are welcome, trans women included. If you are below or above 30s-40s you are still welcome as long as you don't mind hanging out with us old/young gals ;)

See you there <3

name: Digital Enterprise Hub - UK
description:
**Digital Enterprise Hub - UK** supports the policies and principles of Meetup. There are no guarantees and no offer of financial services or assurances. All events are free to attend. The aim of these events is to help each other live better lives by helping create profitable online businesses across the UK. **Digital Enterprise Hub - UK** hosts some of the most successful entrepreneurs in their field.

Many people struggle through their daily lives in the corporate world, often feeling overwhelmed by the challenges they face.  This Meetup group explores ways to eliminate that daily grind and take a path to new ways of living that reflect the meaning, purpose and destiny you envision for yourself.

Join **Digital Enterprise Hub - UK** to find out about potential online business opportunities. Network with other like-minded prospective entrepreneurs and create joint ventures with access to advanced training to help drive your projects. If you dream of a bigger bank balance, a quicker route to making money and a better lifestyle, some of the most experienced coaches who specialise in helping business owners double their sales give you the chance to do this.

name: Business coaching and Systemic Constellation events London
description:
For whom is this group?
**Who wants:**
to be able to break through financial ceiling
set up an internal success mechanism
learn how to reach a new financial level even in times of crisis
Uncover deep habits and work through Generic Scenarios that are limiting your cash flow
Learn to appreciate yourself and your work
You will be able to become visible and declare yourself as an expert
Learn to manage money, multiply and invest
Get back your energy and confidence to start making your dreams come true
learn how to handle money in times of great change: inflation, payment bans, appreciation, loss of earnings, rising prices, etc.
About us:
**COACH & COURSE INSTRUCTOR**
Today, Iryna Goryn, a successful international leader of 7 companies in Ukraine and Europe, her business survived 2 crises in 2008 and 2014 and has now successfully transformed to new world realities.
As a business coach and family and business constellations on crises and transformations, Iryna knows for sure that success is primarily influenced by thinking.
After the coaching sessions, you will regain confidence and motivation for new achievements, you will be able to reach your full potential and use the crisis to reach a new level!
The course is based on 20 years of business introduction experience. Iryna manages a real estate agency in Europe and America, she started her career with online sales of branded items, later she opened beauty salons and dental clinics in Kyiv and Italy.
She also opened an employment company in Poland.
Thanks to its sales,  will now save you from mistakes, fears and wrong financial thinking.
Since this course was first released, two years ago, 1400 students have successfully enrolled and complete it

name: London Fairplay Football
description:
**Welcome to London Fairplay Football (LFF), Founded 2014.**

We pride ourselves on having the best combination on Meetup.com of competitive, quality matches along with great camaraderie and a friendly attitude.

We play football matches between 8 and 10-a-side.

We are completely inclusive: all ages from 18yo upwards, all genders/identities and all abilities are welcome.

Our games are action packed and competitive, without the arguments and bad attitudes you sometimes find elsewhere. This is our mantra: **good vibes only**.

We play on 1/2 of a full size pitch with 8-a-side at Brunel or 9 to 10-a-side at Gunnersbury. This is significantly more enjoyable than playing 5/7 a side at Goals, for example.

The team sheets are managed to ensure the teams are balanced and an entertaining game is played.

You do not need to commit for every game; just come when it suites you. Simply RSVP the night before the game (please see the specific details of the event).

Don't be disheartened if you can only get on the wait list. There are usually a few shuffles before match day and you always have a good chance of getting into a game.

Bibs and balls are provided, just bring yourself along with some shoes/boots that are suitable for AstroTurf.

There is plenty of free parking at both.

For game price, see individual game listings.

name: Richmond Park Velo
description:
Welcome to Richmond Park Velo – the friendliest cycling club in west London!

All our events are posted on this Meetup site but check out our own website which is where you'll need to go to sign up if you decide to join us www.richmondparkvelo.com. Come out for a free introductory ride with us first though!

We meet and start most of our rides in Richmond Park or Kingston west London. If you want to join us, you only have to enjoy cycling, getting fitter and making friends. Oh, and you need a road bike!

This cycling club is for all levels from beginners to advanced. So whether you need help using your gears effectively or want to train competitively and enter sportives with us, RPV is the group for YOU!

The ethos of the club is collaborative and considerate riding – the team is stronger than the individual. Have a look through our Club Ride Rules to see what we aspire to. No one is perfect but we all share the aim to improve!

While some of the members race outside the club environment, we discourage racing on club rides where the stronger riders are expected to help the less strong ones by doing more work at the front rather than riding “off the front”. We regroup after hills and stop for mechanicals and punctures.

Members are given a ranking – Steady/Steady+/Intermediate/Intermediate+/Advanced to ensure that the riders in each group on a club ride are, so far as possible, of the same standard. Click here for more information on our ranking system.

All our ride leaders ascribe to the same values of collaborative and considerate riding and offer constructive criticism and encouragement. Here is what we try to do: Ride Leader Guidelines.

Group rides are offered at various levels to ensure compatibility of members’ abilities. If you are concerned about what level you should start at, drop an email to the Organiser or come to one of our relaxed "Meet the Members" laps evenings where we chat while we cycle and then retire for a beer in a local pub in Richmond or Kingston.

Here’s our very distinctive club kit https://richmondparkvelo.com/club-kit/ We love it and hope you will too! We ask all members to wear at least a club jersey on club rides.

So, what’s in it for you? Loads!

We give beginners tips to on how to ride efficiently and improve their hill-climbing and help intermediate cyclists move up to the next level by developing their group riding skills ie. their ability to ride collaboratively as a team.

We hold regular Skills Sessions where you can learn drafting and communication skills in a safe environment.

We organise cycle rides along many different routes in Surrey, Kent, Berkshire and Oxfordshire.

See what weekly rides and other events we offer here: Calendar

Sunday Club rides are typically 50 miles for Steadies; 50 to 60 miles for Inters and 60 to 70 miles for Inter+ and Advanced. All our club rides involve a break at the half way point for a coffee and a sandwich. Many of the members will stay around for “recovery ales” after the ride in a pub by the river in Kingston.

So, whatever your cycling goals, come, make friends and spin your wheels with Richmond Park Velo!

I hope to meet you soon!

Richard

(Organiser)

name: London Conscious Friends
description:
**🧘 London Conscious Friends 🧘**

Join the largest collective of conscious people in London! This group is for spiritual people seeking to meet and other similar like-minded individuals. For those interested in personal, spiritual growth, connection, healing & transformation.

Our social events are designed for authentic, deep and real connections.

And, For those who want to go deeper we focus on authentic and experiential spirituality - the tools and practices that REALLY make a difference to bring real transformation into your life.

Join our email list for updates about our upcoming events -

name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流
description:
Welcome to our group! This is a community for Chinese and English learners of all levels to learn from one another in a relaxed social environment. Our goals are to have fun, improve language skills through conversation and build a community for Chinese and English learners.

**Why are we different?**

* Structured time to maximise learning
* Facilitated conversations
* Help on hand

**Who is it for?**

* Anyone learning Chinese who would like to improve and practice with native speakers
* Chinese speakers looking to improve their English skills with native speakers
* Learners of all levels

**Format- Speed-chatting!**

* We will pair you up with a native speaker of your target language.
* We will provide fun, engaging topics to prompt your chat.
* Every 30 minutes we rotate with different people. This ensures we cover a diverse range of vocabulary and you get to speak to as many people as possible, making the best use of your time here!

**FAQs:**
**1\. Are the sessions suitable for Beginners?**
Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so beginners will at least learn the short answers to questions like: 'what's your favorite food and where can I get it?' 'Chinese food at China Town!' From then, you can slowly build up your repertoire.

**2\. Are the sessions suitable for intermediate/advanced speakers?**
Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so no matter what level you are at, you will be able to practice it to your level.

**3\. Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?**
No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for at least half the session with our 'Speed-chatting' format!

**About the host**
China Unbound hosts this meetup. We are a Chinese language school specialised in teaching adults. Over the past 7 years, we have helped many professionals and businesses learn Chinese with ease and fun. For inquiries and bookings, email: info@china-unbound.co.uk, or visit [https://china-unbound.co.uk](https://china-unbound.co.uk)

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
欢迎来到 China Unbound's 中英语交流！我们是一个专为中英文学习者提供的交流社区。我们的目标是在轻松的社交环境中相互学习, 通过对话提高语言能力,和为中文和英文学习者建立社区。在这里，你可以找到以英语为母语的人练习和提高你的英语水平。

**我们有什么不同？**

* 妥善安排时间以便您更有效地学习
* 专人主持活动
* 现场协助引导交流讨论

适合什么人？

* 想提高英语水平的学习者
* 想学中文的学习者
* 任何水平的学习者

模式：快速聊天！

* 我们将为您安排一至三位英语为母语的语言伙伴，每隔30分钟，我们会与不同的人轮换。
* 我们将提供有趣的话题，协助您开始对话。
* 这个模式确保我们覆盖不同的词汇范围，也可让您尽可能与更多的人交谈，充分有效地利用您在这里的时间！

常见问题解答：
1\. 我最后会不会一直说中文而一无所获？
-不会，因为每个人都必须用我们的“快速聊天”模式用中/英文交流至少一半的时间！

2\. 这些小组适合我的水平吗？
-是的，我们设置问题的方式使您可以根据自己的意愿回答问题的长短，因此，无论您处于什么级别，都可以按照自己的水平练习。

🤘 这个小组由china unbound支持，我们是一所专门教授成人的中文学校。在过去的 7 年里，我们帮助许多专业人士和企业轻松有趣地学习中文。 如需查询和预订，请发送电子邮件至：info@china-unbound.co.uk，或访问 [https://china-unbound.co.uk](https://china-unbound.co.uk)

我们期待很快见到你。
Grace x

name: Social Caterpillars 🐛 🦋
description:
This community is designed for Working professionals that don’t have many friends as they have spent last few years of life focusing on their career. And finally have some time to let off the heat and would like to become a social butterfly. This community will help us all to organise Meet-ups that would result in developing friendships and have a group of friends to experience life with. A life full of friends and adventures 🦋

2. Build a community of friends
3. And of course have loads of fun

name: Mums In Ctrl
description:
Mums in Ctrl is an empowerment platform for working mums worldwide! We believe that every mother is a human with her own dreams, passions and ambitions. However, it is difficult to achieve this kind of synergy, without support, the right resources and the right information.
 
Mums in Ctrl are committed to providing daily inspiration, motivation and advice for mothers who are in business. We give mothers a community and a safe space to make other friends who are working mums, to network and relax in a safe space at our events and on our social media platform.

Tap in...

name: London Cosmopolitan Muslims
description:
This group is different. It’s about exploring, seeking and experiencing adventure, excitement, stretching yourself, seeing stunning places and facing personal challenge.

Find yourself in the moment of exhilaration, beautiful calm, and the magnificence of the outdoors.

It's about building an adventuring community, experiencing, adventure: exploration, discovery, wonderment. It's about friends, laughter, silence and sharing memories.

name: Dorking Meet Up
description:
**A local group for local people of Dorking and immediate villages/towns.**

Our group is for adults of all ages who want to meet new people, make new friends and socialise. There will be all types of events and we are happy to take suggestions.
We are NOT a dating site!

No need to feel nervous about meeting people you don't know- we are super friendly.

When joining we recommend you have the phone app so you don't miss out on reminders and messages.

This group will have no membership fee at the present time but if the size grows Meet UP will increase the admin fees to run it and at that point there maybe a one off £5 per year fee per member.
This will be communicated in advance to members and they can decide if they want to stay. At present I am prepared to cover the current monthly cost.

name: London Extreme Metal meetup
description:
This is a friendly meetup group for metal lovers of all subgenres to head out to gigs, drink, make friends and chat about anything we fancy




This is a new group so lots more gigs and meet ups to be announced very soon.

name: Polska Grupa Turystyczno Krajoznawcza w Londynie
description:
WITAMY WSZYSTKICH MILOSNIKOW WYPOCZYNKU NA SWIEZYM POWIETRZU


Jesli chcesz spedzic weekend milo, zdrowo, zobaczyc nowe miejsca i poznac sympatycznych rodakow, dolacz do nas i przyprowadz swoich znajomych. 


Nie musisz byc atleta, ani zawodowym kolarzem, nasze spotkania  sa dokladnie opisane (wraz z dlugoscia trasy) wiec kazdy moze ocenic czy jest to wycieczka na jego sily.

Kilka slow o naszej historii: PGTK zostala zalozona w kwietniu 2010 i zainspirowana grupa turystyczna HAWOG, dzialajaca w Harrow. Celem grupy jest wspolne poznawanie pieknych krajobrazow Wielkiej Brytanii maszerujac na wlasnych nogach, pedalujac lub przemieszczajac sie innymi metodami wymagajacymi wysilku wlasnych miesni.


Od poczatku nasza dzialalnosc spotkala sie z wielkim entuzjazmem i zainteresowaniem, co szybko zaowocowalo rosnaca rzesza czlonkow i wieloma ciekawymi wycieczkami, ktore nadal mozna zobaczyc pod zakladka Past Meetups.


W malowniczych plenerach, czasem w ulewnym deszczu, czasem w promieniach slonca zawiazalo sie wiele trwalych przyjazni, a takze nieformalnych grup dzielacach podobne zainteresowania.

Z czasem rozrosla sie rowniez nasza druzyna organizatorska i do zalozycielki grupy dolaczyli kolejni entuzjasci pelni ciekawych pomyslow i checi podzielenia sie nimi z innymi.  
Jesli chcesz przezyc z nami przygode na szlaku po prostu dolacz do naszej nastepnej wycieczki.

I TO CHYBA TYLE, DO ZOBACZENIA NA TRASIE!

A KTO JEST ZAINTERESOWANY SPOTKANIAMI KULTURALNYMI :

Istnieje rowniez Polish Culture Group - Londyn z Glowy, ktora spotyka sie na rozne imprezy kulturalne. Mozecie ja znalezc pod linkiem:

http://www.meetup.com/londyn-z-glowy/

name: Socialising everybody welcome.
description:
Hi I thought I'd create a group purely for socialising and making new friends.no shouting over the music in loud bars where people can really shine and make new friends in a conducive environment.
i aim to bring all races age groups nationalities together no inclusiveness here after all people of all types can be a great friend.
I will host pub events eating out picnics walks and dating events.

name: Islington Book Club
description:
We're a friendly group of adult men and women of all ages and from all walks of life, some of whom work, study or live in North London or the City but many who don't. Our ages mostly range from early twenties to late forties but we accept (and have) adult members of all ages.

As well as encouraging reading, it's a fantastic way to meet people and our meetings are great fun!

Islington Book Club is a successful reading group which has run continuously since being founded in January 2008. Run by Francis H up to 2018, it is now led by Rich P, Sam B, Helen M, Susan B, & Sam V 

We meet in Islington at 7.30pm on the last Monday of each month to drink, eat and discuss books. The discussion is quite lively and we have a great deal of fun!

As well as our monthly book discussions, we run a number of other social activities throughout the year, including our annual literary themed summer pub crawl!

The book club's nominal annual subscription fee is simply to cover our Meetup.com running costs and we are strictly not-for-profit; all meetings are free for paid-up members. People who do not pay the membership fee may be removed from the group.

To pay your £5 memberships dues, please pay via PayPal to rsvpickup@hotmail.com. Make sure you label the transaction 'Book Club Subs'.

If you're interested in joining, please click on the red "Join us!" button. We hope to see you soon!

name: Coding Black Females
description:
Coding Black Females is a nonprofit organisation set up in 2017 to bring black women and gender minorities in tech together. We aim to
• Build and grow the community
• Provide opportunities to learn new skills and showcase the talent in the community
• Support and empower each other
Our mission is to be the largest community of black women and gender minorites in tech across the world!
Join our network if you are a black woman or non-binary in tech or would like to be in tech, so that we can empower each other and the next generation!

For all things CBF visit: https://codingblackfemales.com
Get involved with our #VisibleInTech campaign: [https://codingblackfemales.com/visibleintech](https://codingblackfemales.com/visibleintech)
Sign up to our mailing list: [https://mailchi.mp/59b1f57bb4e2/landing-page](https://mailchi.mp/59b1f57bb4e2/landing-page)
Loads of useful resources on our website: [https://codingblackfemales.com](https://codingblackfemales.com)
Event ideas: [https://goo.gl/forms/FBNiF8K2GTS072PR2](https://goo.gl/forms/FBNiF8K2GTS072PR2)

name: Bracknell & Ascot Walking and Social
description:
Welcome ! 

Before sending a join request , please note that we require a nominal membership fee of £12.00  per year, payable in January when you request membership. This covers administration and running costs.   Due to Covid limiting the number of events we can put  on ,for 2021  only, this payment will be prorated per month ( ie join in April , fee is £9 ) 

This is a group for those interested in walking, socialising and doing new things.  We hold a short walk local walks most evenings  in the week just to get some fresh air after work and go for longer walks further afield most weekends. We hope to offer a good selection of walks from easy sociable walks to longer distances.

note : Whilst we do our best to ensure that our walks are safe and enjoyable for every walker participating, in the unlikely event of an accident please understand that you are responsible for your own well being and that we (the organisers and other members) cannot accept any responsibility for loss,injury or any other unwanted incident that may occur at our planned events.

We try to do a variety of different activities such as going for evening meals locally, catch a film, hold quiz nights and go for the odd trip away. If you are interested in meeting new people and enjoying a social side to your walking this group should be for you.

Everyone is welcome to pop along to any event, but if you are a little shy, then please contact one of the organizers and we will do everything we can to make your first event with us as easy as possible.

Do join us and come along for some fun, don't just sit at home on your own

PLEASE ASSURE YOU HAVE A PHOTO OF YOURSELF ON YOUR PROFILE AS WE DO NOT ACCEPT ANONYMOUS MEMBERSHIP.

name: Women Who Code London
description:
Women Who Code is the largest and most active community of engineers dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers. We envision a world where women are representative as technical executives, founders, VCs, board members, and software engineers. Our programs are designed to get you there.

Who should join?

Our community is for professional women in technology careers, including software engineers, developers, UX/UI designers, data scientists and more. Current and aspiring coders are welcome. Bring your laptop and a friend!


What to expect?

Our events offer free hands-on technical events, study groups, panel discussions, lightning talks, and keynotes featuring influential tech industry experts, innovators, and investors. We help you build the skills you need to raise your professional profile and achieve greater career success.


Support us:

WWCode relies on donations to support this catalytic movement. Funding directly impacts our ability to deliver programs and expand to more cities, ensuring that even more women have the opportunity to excel in tech careers. womenwhocode.com/donate


Share a Job with our Community:

Post your jobs on the Women Who Code Job Board and hire from our exclusive community of technical professionals. Get started at womenwhocode.com/companies.


Code of Conduct:

WWCode is an inclusive community, dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, socioeconomic status, caste, creed, political affiliation, or preferred programming language(s). Our events are intended to inspire women to excel in technology careers, and anyone who is there for this purpose is welcome. We do not tolerate harassment of members in any form.


Our Code of Conduct applies to all WWCode events and online communities. Read the full version and access our incident report form at www.womenwhocode.com/codeofconduct


Terms of Service:

Everyone who participates in our community agrees to abide by our Terms of Service. Read it at www.womenwhocode.com/tos


Privacy Policy:

Everyone who participates in our community agrees to abide by our Privacy Policy.

Read it at www.womenwhocode.com/privacy-policy




Connect with #WWCode London:

WWCode London: https://womenwhocode.com/london 

Twitter: https://twitter.com/wwcodelondon

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wwcodelondon

Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/wwcodelondon/

Slack: https://bit.ly/wwcodelondonslack


#WWCode Global Network

Facebook: https://facebook.com/womenwhocode 

Twitter: https://twitter.com/womenwhocode 

Code Review: bit.ly/WWCodeReview  

Github: https://github.com/orgs/WomenWhoCode 

https://womenwhocode.com

name: London Transgender Meetup Group
description: This is a fun, friendly and inclusive Meetup for ALL trans people in London. We have regular meetups in London and will organise other events if the interest is there.

name: SQUAD Advanced Social Volleyball
description:
SQUAD Advanced Volleyball

Sunday afternoons 2-4pm at Bacon's College in Canada Water

Level: Advanced / Upper Intermediate only. (Players need to have strong all-round skills and know the 5-1 rotation system and positions)

Session Structure: 45 mins warm up and drills & 75 mins playing time

Cost: £ 10 per session

Maximum Capacity: 14 players.

Book your place ASAP and any question please contact us here or via our Facebook page.
